<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/24/imf-report-shows-overwhelming-public-debt?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
On the Whole, Global Governments Are in the Hole
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Capitol Hill with a long receipt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDg4L2NhcGl0b2xfaGlsbF93aXRoX2FfbG9uZ19yZWNlaXB0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the past few months, an unstoppable force (massive government spending) has hit an immovable object (massive declines in government revenues). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The result? Historic government debt, according to a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-24/emergency-virus-spending-will-push-global-debt-ratio-above-100?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new report</a> from the International Monetary Fund (IMF), which says we’re approaching public debt levels not seen since World War II. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">That’s a worrisome milestone </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The IMF predicts global public debt will surpass 100% of GDP for the first time ever this year. It estimates the debt load will increase almost 19 percentage points over last year, a much bigger jump than the one that followed the 2008 financial crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the U.S., <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/f29bf66c-d3fa-462e-9026-b1bba49ec2cd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">we’re running up</a> an especially lengthy tab without having the income to show for it—the IMF said the U.S. budget deficit will reach nearly 24% of GDP this year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">While we’re on the subject...</strong></span><span>the report </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/24/imf-global-economy-to-contract-with-coronavirus-recovery-slow.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">also revised</a></span><span> previous doom-and-gloom economic forecasts for the doomier and gloomier. It expects global GDP to decline 4.9% this year and U.S. GDP to slide 8%. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The IMF is not team "V-shaped recovery."</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what do we do? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The IMF advised governments to keep the relief funds flowing, despite the scary debt numbers. “While rising debt is not a free lunch, that doesn’t mean we shouldn’t be buying lunch for everyone right now,” said Harvard economist and double negative over-user Kenneth Rogoff. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the IMF also added that governments could try to curb tax avoidance, broaden tax bases, and potentially make their tax systems more progressive. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Countries that control their own currency, like the U.S., are at an advantage when it comes to managing debt; the money printers at the Fed can always <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-debt-is-soaring-debt-risks-are-not-11587646819?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make sure</a> the federal government is able to borrow. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/24/ford-debut-new-f150?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
There Really Is Something Bout a Truck
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Ford F-150" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDkwL2ZvcmRfZi0xNTAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Needpix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whatever it is, you can witness it tonight at 8pm ET. That’s when <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/24/new-ford-f-150-to-feature-integrated-generator-over-the-air-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ford will reveal</a> the redesigned F-150 it's been hyping for months. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lest you think, “sweet, new truck”...agreed, but it’s much more than that. The F-150 has been the U.S.’ best-selling vehicle for decades. As for the broader F-Series family, here are some nuts truck stats:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a </span><span><a href="https://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/ford/2020/06/24/fords-series-cash-haul-ranks-near-iphone-among-us-products/112003226/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a></span><span> commissioned by Ford, Boston Consulting Group found the F-Series made about $42 billion in revenue last year, not far behind the iPhone's $55 billion in revenue.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The F-Series generated more revenue in 2019 than the MLB, NHL, NFL, and NBA combined.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On its own, the F-Series would be a Fortune 100 company larger than McDonald’s, Nike, Coca-Cola, and Starbucks in terms of revenue.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, car types don’t argue over <em>whether</em> the F-Series is the sales leader, they fight over <em>how long</em> it’s been the leader. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Like most of the biz world outside Silicon Valley, Ford needs a W-150 right now as it tries to pay down debt racked up during the pandemic. Everything's riding on this truck. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LEGAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/24/bayer-agrees-10-billion-settlement-roundup-lawsuits?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bayer Just Wants to Settle Down
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Roundup " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDg5L3JvdW5kdXAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><div>"<a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/jeepersmedia/14925723560/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Roundup Monsanto</a>" (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>) by <a href="https://www.flickr.com/people/jeepersmedia/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">JeepersMedia</a>
</div></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, life sciences giant Bayer started to crawl out of its Himalayan-sized mountain of legal trouble. It <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/bayer-reaches-10-5-billion-settlement-roundup-cancer-lawsuits-n1232026?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">agreed to pay</a> over $10 billion to settle an estimated 125,000 filed and unfiled claims over Roundup, the weedkiller Bayer inherited when it bought Monsanto. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Bayer acquired Monsanto for $63 billion in June 2018, and the lawsuits, which claimed that Roundup’s key ingredient, glyphosate, caused non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma, came fast and furious. Over the next two years, Bayer suffered a series of courtroom losses that led to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-bayer-monsanto-became-one-of-the-worst-corporate-dealsin-12-charts-11567001577?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">headlines</a> like, "How Bayer-Monsanto Became One of the Worst Corporate Deals—in 12 Charts."</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bayer has said repeatedly that Roundup is safe, and the settlement included no admission of liability or wrongdoing. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Bayer isn’t out of the weed-free woods. There are still at least 25,000 unresolved claims over Roundup, which is the main reason why it's <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/business/roundup-settlement-lawsuits.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set aside</a> $1.25 billion for future litigation. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FITNESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/24/crossfit-cuts-glassman-good?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
CrossFit Cuts Glassman Out for Good
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Former CrossFit CEO Greg Glassman is <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/24/business/greg-glassman-selling-crossfit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">selling the company</a> he founded after a laundry list of allegations surfaced over his past conduct.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The laundry list</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On June 6, Glassman tweeted an offensive remark regarding the death of George Floyd, prompting some gym owners and major sponsor Reebok to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/08/business/greg-glassman-crossfit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">renounce their ties to the organization</a></span><span>, and eventually led to Glassman stepping down as CEO.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Then, a </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/20/style/greg-glassman-crossfit-sexism.html?action=click&module=RelatedLinks&pgtype=Article&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT article</a></span><span> on June 20 exposed a persistent culture of “routine and rampant sexual harassment” within the organization, especially from Glassman himself. Glassman denied the allegations. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What happens now? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Glassman intends to sell CrossFit to Eric Roza, the former senior VP of Oracle Data Cloud and the owner of a CrossFit gym in Boulder, CO. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“My view is simple: Racism and sexism are abhorrent and will not be tolerated in CrossFit,” wrote Roza. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The financial terms of the deal haven't been disclosed, but by all accounts Roza is taking over a hobbled CrossFit brand—the company has been forced to downsize, cutting 65 employees over the past two years as it’s shifted its messaging away from competition to focus on health initiatives.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/24/economic-political-consequences-follow-djokovics-tennis-tournament?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oh No, Novak
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Novak Djokovic " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDg3L25vdmFrX2Rqb2tvdmljLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>GLYN KIRK/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The No. 1 ranked tennis player in the world, Novak Djokovic, <a href="https://apnews.com/a05bd74bc4c43bc1373890e594083762?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tested positive</a> for COVID-19 on Tuesday after he hosted a charity tennis tournament in the Croatian town of Zadar. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>According to Djokovic’s Twitter the event was an effort to celebrate improving health conditions and “unite people for philanthropic reasons.” </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two things that aren't a good idea right now: uniting and celebrating.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A small tennis tournament has major implications</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Politics: </strong></span><span>Croatian Prime Minister Andrej Plenković attended the tournament and spoke briefly with Djokovic. Now Plenković faces </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-24/djokovic-encounter-risks-sinking-croat-pm-s-re-election-bid?utm_medium=social&cmpid=socialflow-twitter-business&utm_campaign=socialflow-organic&utm_source=twitter&utm_content=business&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scrutiny</a></span><span> for refusing to isolate himself. “He’ll lose votes. The only question is how many,” Zarko Puhovski, a political science professor at the University of Zagreb, told Bloomberg. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tourism: </strong></span><span>Faced with a rising number of cases, </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/9c93ca6bc9b9066a3b3e9af105cea53e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Croatia announced yesterday</a></span><span> it was imposing border restrictions on neighboring countries, further delaying the rebound of tourism, the most important sector of the Croatian economy.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> A number of high profile players have claimed that Djoker’s actions could derail the sport’s return. “Some people have said maybe this has put the U.S. Open in doubt—which it may well do,’’ said British tennis star Andy Murray.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NYC marathon, the world's largest, has been canceled this year due to the coronavirus. But at least this gives us an opportunity to ask you a little bit of marathon trivia.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The question: </strong>The current Olympic record for the men’s marathon was set by Samuel Wanjiru in 2008 with a time of 2:06:32. href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/24/imf-report-shows-overwhelming-public-debt?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nOn the Whole, Global Governments Are in the Hole\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Capitol Hill with a long receipt\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDg4L2NhcGl0b2xfaGlsbF93aXRoX2FfbG9uZ19yZWNlaXB0LnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the past few months, an unstoppable force (massive government spending) has hit an immovable object (massive declines in government revenues). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe result? Historic government debt, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-24/emergency-virus-spending-will-push-global-debt-ratio-above-100?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew report\u003c/a\u003e from the International Monetary Fund (IMF), which says we’re approaching public debt levels not seen since World War II. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThat’s a worrisome milestone \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe IMF predicts global public debt will surpass 100% of GDP for the first time ever this year. It estimates the debt load will increase almost 19 percentage points over last year, a much bigger jump than the one that followed the 2008 financial crisis. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the U.S., \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/f29bf66c-d3fa-462e-9026-b1bba49ec2cd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewe’re running up\u003c/a\u003e an especially lengthy tab without having the income to show for it—the IMF said the U.S. budget deficit will reach nearly 24% of GDP this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhile we’re on the subject...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe report \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/24/imf-global-economy-to-contract-with-coronavirus-recovery-slow.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealso revised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e previous doom-and-gloom economic forecasts for the doomier and gloomier. It expects global GDP to decline 4.9% this year and U.S. GDP to slide 8%. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe IMF is not team \"V-shaped recovery.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what do we do? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe IMF advised governments to keep the relief funds flowing, despite the scary debt numbers. “While rising debt is not a free lunch, that doesn’t mean we shouldn’t be buying lunch for everyone right now,” said Harvard economist and double negative over-user Kenneth Rogoff. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the IMF also added that governments could try to curb tax avoidance, broaden tax bases, and potentially make their tax systems more progressive. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eCountries that control their own currency, like the U.S., are at an advantage when it comes to managing debt; the money printers at the Fed can always \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-debt-is-soaring-debt-risks-are-not-11587646819?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emake sure\u003c/a\u003e the federal government is able to borrow. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F24%2Fimf-report-shows-overwhelming-public-debt\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDkwL2ZvcmRfZi0xNTAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNeedpix\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhatever it is, you can witness it tonight at 8pm ET. That’s when \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/06/24/new-ford-f-150-to-feature-integrated-generator-over-the-air-updates.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFord will reveal\u003c/a\u003e the redesigned F-150 it's been hyping for months. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLest you think, “sweet, new truck”...agreed, but it’s much more than that. The F-150 has been the U.S.’ best-selling vehicle for decades. As for the broader F-Series family, here are some nuts truck stats:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.detroitnews.com/story/business/autos/ford/2020/06/24/fords-series-cash-haul-ranks-near-iphone-among-us-products/112003226/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e commissioned by Ford, Boston Consulting Group found the F-Series made about $42 billion in revenue last year, not far behind the iPhone's $55 billion in revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe F-Series generated more revenue in 2019 than the MLB, NHL, NFL, and NBA combined.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn its own, the F-Series would be a Fortune 100 company larger than McDonald’s, Nike, Coca-Cola, and Starbucks in terms of revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, car types don’t argue over \u003cem\u003ewhether\u003c/em\u003e the F-Series is the sales leader, they fight over \u003cem\u003ehow long\u003c/em\u003e it’s been the leader. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eLike most of the biz world outside Silicon Valley, Ford needs a W-150 right now as it tries to pay down debt racked up during the pandemic. cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, life sciences giant Bayer started to crawl out of its Himalayan-sized mountain of legal trouble. It \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/bayer-reaches-10-5-billion-settlement-roundup-cancer-lawsuits-n1232026?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eagreed to pay\u003c/a\u003e over $10 billion to settle an estimated 125,000 filed and unfiled claims over Roundup, the weedkiller Bayer inherited when it bought Monsanto. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eBayer acquired Monsanto for $63 billion in June 2018, and the lawsuits, which claimed that Roundup’s key ingredient, glyphosate, caused non-Hodgkin’s lymphoma, came fast and furious. Over the next two years, Bayer suffered a series of courtroom losses that led to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/how-bayer-monsanto-became-one-of-the-worst-corporate-dealsin-12-charts-11567001577?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eheadlines\u003c/a\u003e like, \"How Bayer-Monsanto Became One of the Worst Corporate Deals—in 12 Charts.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBayer has said repeatedly that Roundup is safe, and the settlement included no admission of liability or wrongdoing. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eBayer isn’t out of the weed-free woods. There are still at least 25,000 unresolved claims over Roundup, which is the main reason why it's \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/24/business/roundup-settlement-lawsuits.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eset aside\u003c/a\u003e $1.25 billion for future litigation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/24/business/greg-glassman-selling-crossfit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eselling the company\u003c/a\u003e he founded after a laundry list of allegations surfaced over his past conduct.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe laundry list\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn June 6, Glassman tweeted an offensive remark regarding the death of George Floyd, prompting some gym owners and major sponsor Reebok to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/08/business/greg-glassman-crossfit/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erenounce their ties to the organization\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and eventually led to Glassman stepping down as CEO.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThen, a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/20/style/greg-glassman-crossfit-sexism.html?action=click\u0026module=RelatedLinks\u0026pgtype=Article\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT article\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on June 20 exposed a persistent culture of “routine and rampant sexual harassment” within the organization, especially from Glassman himself. Glassman denied the allegations. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat happens now? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGlassman intends to sell CrossFit to Eric Roza, the former senior VP of Oracle Data Cloud and the owner of a CrossFit gym in Boulder, CO. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“My view is simple: Racism and sexism are abhorrent and will not be tolerated in CrossFit,” wrote Roza. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe financial terms of the deal haven't been disclosed, but by all accounts Roza is taking over a hobbled CrossFit brand—the company has been forced to downsize, cutting 65 employees over the past two years as it’s shifted its messaging away from competition to
